Description:
Oversee daily cafeteria operations, ensuring efficient food service and customer satisfaction.
Manage and train cafeteria staff, including cooks, servers, cashiers, and support personnel.
Maintain food quality, portion control, and presentation according to established standards.
Collaborate with kitchen staff to create and update the cafeteria menu.
Monitor inventory levels and order supplies and ingredients as needed.
Implement cost-control measures to optimize expenses without compromising quality.
Address customer feedback and complaints promptly and professionally.
Ensure compliance with health and safety regulations and obtain necessary licenses and permits.
Analyze financial data, manage the cafeteria budget, and implement pricing strategies.
Conduct training programs for staff on food preparation, customer service, and safety protocols.
Implement sustainable practices such as waste reduction and energy conservation.Skills
Skills:
Minimum of 5 years experience as a cafeteria/restaurant manager or in a related food service management role.
Strong leadership and interpersonal skills.
Excellent communication and problem-solving abilities.
Knowledge of food safety and health regulations in cafeteria settings.
Understanding of cost management and financial analysis.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks.
Flexibility to work during cafeteria operating hours, which may include early mornings, evenings, and weekends.
A degree or diploma in hospitality management, food service, or a related field is preferred but not mandatory.

As a Cafeteria Manager, your dedication to providing exceptional food service, ensuring customer satisfaction, and efficiently managing cafeteria operations will be critical to creating a positive dining experience for all patrons. Your ability to lead and inspire your team will be essential in maintaining the cafeteria's success and contributing to the overall well-being of the organization or institution it serves.
